page.title: 16GLENIFFER BRAES COUNTRY PARK
page.content: The country park is 5 square miles in area. It is made up of 4 main areas, McDonalds Walk, Robertsons Park, Tannahill Walkway and Glen Park. There is also a farm called Brownside Farm. Robertsons Park is mainly a place to rest and also has play equipment for children. Near Robertsons park is the 'Bonnie Wee Well.' It has a verse, by Hugh McDonald of Bridgeton, written on a placque beside it. To the east of Robertsons Park is Tannahill Walkway and Glen Park. The Glen Park has a one and a half mile nature trail in it which can take anything from half an hour to 3 hours to explore. Glen Park also has two dams and the water is used in the dyeworks in Paisley. The small reservoirs are protected by special laws and it is illegal to canoe or swim in them because it is dangerous.
